alert.note: Alert for Duchesne; Wasatch (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 4:50PM MDT until August 17 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The Dollar Ridge Burn Scar in... West Central Duchesne County in northern Utah... Southeastern Wasatch County in northern Utah... * Until 600 PM MDT. * At 450 PM MDT, The Strawberry River at Pinnacles has risen from 50 cfs to 300 cfs and climbing from thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Dollar Ridge Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Strawberry River drainage. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Dollar Ridge Burn Scar. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Dollar Ridge Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Starvation Reservoir and Strawberry Reservoir. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: A debris flow is expected to impact the Strawberry River corridor from Strawberry Reservoir to Starvation Reservoir. People living in this area should take action to ensure their safety! Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
